reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable - great bathroom. Bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The pool & jacuzzi are very nice - except, too many children. You can have a private cabana at the pool and drink service, but with only one pool (nice, but not incredibly large) for adults and children, it is really not a relaxing atmosphere for an adult. I know they are doing an expansion in the next few years - adding 400+ room and another pool. It would be nice if one of them was adults only.
reviews.title: Great Room; No Room at Wheel of Fortune

reviews.text: The spa was very nice - I spent an afternoon there having a facial, pedicure and manicure. The staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: Smokey!

reviews.text: We were there during the week, so the casino was busy but not crowded. There did seem to be a lot of people smoking, but I wasn't overwhelmed with the smoke. There is a non-smoking area of slot machines.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Good

reviews.text: The buffet is quite nice with a lot a variety. Room service was also very prompt and the food was good.
reviews.title: Nice Room At First Glance

reviews.text: What a great alternative to Vegas, Tahoe and Reno! We live in San Francisco and wanted some place that was easy to get to, but still had a splurgy, getaway feel. This place fit the bill perfectly. We will be back. The rooms are large and well-appointed- I'd say it was just as nice as the room I stayed in at the Bellagio in Vegas. The pool area is lovely, with misters and cabanas, a fireplace and a hot tub...scenery is nice too. I thoroughly enjoy my spa experience - the facilities are fantastic. This place is top quality.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
room reserved (with confirmation no.) but not available
reviews.text: I had a confirmation number for a room (non-smoking) I was supposed to stay in but was not available when I arrived. I ended up staying in a room (smoking). I was really upset because I even called in that day to inform them that I was on my way there and was reassured that there was a non-smoking room available for me. I made reservation one (1) week in advance and even had my credit card number with them. What can management do about this?

reviews.title: Great getaway except . . .
reviews.text: This resort is in the lovely Capay Valley on Indian land. It was recently remodeled - lots of stone work and natural materials, beautiful, spacious rooms, bathrooms have a large shower and bathtub, beds are very comfortable with down comforters, restaurants are from average fast food to a fabulous, 5-star restaurant with extensive menu and great wine list. Spa was terrific - massages, jacuzzi, sauna, etc. BUT - housekeeping was spotty (one room was NEVER cleaned during a two-night stay, another partially cleaned), check-in was delayed for almost 3 hours and, the worst of all, smoking is allowed EVERYWHERE. Just a walk through the casino leaves your clothes stinky. We were ready to play some poker or blackjack but never did because of the cigarette smoke. Thousands of slot machines but, again, cigarettes everywhere. Cache Creek could be a first class resort but probably not likely to change.

reviews.title: Miles from no where
reviews.text: Well let's see, Our room was great, just the right size for 2 adults and the new pool rather small in size but was awesome. We went on a saturday night and the casino was packed ,there was no room to walk all the smoke and people where a turn off but we had a good time. It seems that there was a long walk to the elevators and they took forever to get to the 5th floor.There's plenty of place's to eat and the casino layout is alright but it's a casino in Calif and if your used to Nevada casino's your in for a big susprise. If you have time and your in the area it's worth the stay. Remember that there's NOTHING in the area for 20 miles so bring what you need. The place is rather expensive , so bring plenty of money without the one arm bandits. C-ya soon. PSC
